title: 104_s1620
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Dredge Disposal Act of 1996" and pertains to dredged material disposal facilities. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 is amended to include provisions for dredged material disposal facilities as a general navigation feature for Federal navigation projects. This includes upland, aquatic, and confined aquatic disposal facilities for harbors and inland harbors. The Federal share of costs for construction is limited to funds not required for operation and maintenance. The Water Resources Development Act of 1986 amended to include provisions for dredged material disposal facilities for Federal navigation projects. The Federal share of construction costs is limited to funds not needed for operation and maintenance, with a maximum federal share of $25,000,000 for operation and maintenance activities in a fiscal year. The Federal share of operation and maintenance costs for Federal navigation projects is limited to $25,000,000 per fiscal year. Eligible costs include constructing and maintaining dredged material disposal facilities for harbors and inland harbors, as well as environmental dredging and disposal facilities. The Federal government covers costs for navigation projects, environmental dredging, and disposal facilities for contaminated sediments in Federal navigation channels. Preference is given to port areas where harbor maintenance fees exceed Federal expenditures. The Secretary gives preference to port areas where harbor maintenance fees exceed Federal expenditures for eligible projects reimbursed from the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund. This subsection applies to dredged material disposal facilities and associated navigation projects without awarded construction contracts. Existing agreements may be amended unless the non-Federal interest requests otherwise within 30 days of enactment. The subsection requires cooperative agreements between the Secretary and non-Federal interests to be amended to conform to new provisions, including Federal share of project costs for dredged material disposal facilities. The amendment applies prospectively and does not increase non-Federal costs for dredged material disposal facilities.
